name: Kuya Ate Summer Employment Program
description: Provides high school students with the opportunity to explore varying career roles in a youth serving non profit organizations. Program offers holistic individualized support, job readiness training, social emotional and culturally sensitive support and professional, career & leadership development. Also provides access to individualized case management and various workshops.
fullDescription: Provides high school students with the opportunity to explore varying career roles in a youth serving non profit organizations. Program offers holistic individualized support, job readiness training, social emotional and culturally sensitive support and professional, career & leadership development. Also provides access to individualized case management and various workshops.
whatTheyOffer: Provides high school students with the opportunity to explore varying career roles in a youth serving non profit organizations. Program offers holistic individualized support, job readiness training, social emotional and culturally sensitive support and professional, career & leadership development. Also provides access to individualized case management and various workshops.
howToGetIt: To apply fill out the application in May for the Kuya Ate Summer Employment Program (KASE). Applications close once registration is full.
agency: West Bay Pilipino Multi Service Center
